Package controller

Class modifyProduct

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.modifyProduct
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class modifyProduct
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller that handles the logic for the Modify Product screen based on the modifyproduct.fxml file.

    • Method Detail

      • getProducttoModify

        public static void getProducttoModify​(int index,
                                      Product product)
        Gets product to modify. After loading in the object a method is called to retrieve the associated parts for that product.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the product from the allProducts table.
        product - The Product object to be modified.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Initializes the controller and sets up the columns in the tableviews with the correct data. Also initializes the form and sets the value of the text fields to the appropriate values.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • validateInput

        private boolean validateInput()
        Validates user input in text fields to make sure null or invalid types are not entered.
        Returns:
        Boolean b; true if input is valid, false if any of the values does not pass validation.

      • onSaveProduct

        public void onSaveProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Event handler to handle saving the modified part. If input is valid, sets the values of the product's fields to the values from user input, then calls the updateProduct method from the Inventory class to replace the existing product with the updated version. Error messages will be generated if invalid input is found. Closes the window on a successful save. LOGICAL ERROR: When I originally created the modifyProduct class I was able to get it to retrieve the associated parts when it opened the product, but noticed that if I modified the product, saved the changes, and pulled the product up to modify again, the associated parts would be missing. I discovered that, despite having changed from creating a new product object to just updating the existing one, I still had a method in place to clear the associated items from the old product. Removing that method solved the problem and allowed the parts to show properly.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Used to determine the source of the triggering event so that the * related window can be closed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Not used.

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Event handler to handle a user choosing the cancel button. Provides a confirmation dialog to allow the user the choice to cancel their action; if user chooses to cancel, no information is removed, and if user chooses OK the information in the window is discarded and the window is closed.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Used to determine the source of the triggering event so that the related window can be closed.

      • addAssocPart

        public void addAssocPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Adds selected part from the allParts table to the associatedParts table and updates the tableview to show the new associated parts. An error message will be generated if no part is selected or if the user tries to add a part that is already associated with the product.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Not used.

      • onSearch

        public void onSearch​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Searches the list of all parts. The search will look for a partID first, and if no part with that ID is found it will execute a partial string search. Any parts found are added to a list and shown in the updated tableview.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Not used.

      • searchByPartName

        private javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> searchByPartName​(java.lang.String partialName)
        Method to iterate through allParts and search for any items matching the partial string from user input.
        Parameters:
        partialName - Gets the string to search on from user input in the search text field.
        Returns:
        Returns an ObservableList populated with any items that meet search criteria.

      • searchByPartID

        private Part searchByPartID​(int partID)
        Method to iterate through allParts and search for any items matching the part ID from user input.
        Parameters:
        partID - Gets the Part ID to search on from user input in the search text field.
        Returns:
        Returns the Part matching the Part ID, if any. Returns null if no parts found.

      • removeAssocPart

        public void removeAssocPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Removes the selected part from the associated parts for the product. Provides a confirmation dialog to allow the user the choice to cancel their action; if user chooses to cancel, no information is removed, and if user chooses OK the selected part is removed and the tableview of associated parts is updated. An error will display if the user attempts to remove a part with no part selected.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Not used.
